name: N-(4-decylphenyl)-4-methylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2315
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine base, with a melting point around 106°C, due to the presence of a piperazine ring and a methyl group. The decyl group (C10) adds approximately +20 due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The phenyl group (C6) adds approximately +20 due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The methyl group (C1) adds approximately +5 due to increased molecular weight and rigidity.
